page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This block covers the village of Nocton and part of the village of Dunston.These are both rural villages, approximately 8 miles south east of the city of Lincoln. Dunston is an attractive village with a mixture of old stone built houses and small developments. Many people commute to Lincoln and Sleaford for their work.The figure for Dunston in the 1981 census was 491. Nocton is also a pleasant village. Many of the houses are old and there are no new developments.The figure for Nocton in the last census was 1008 but this figure has been greatly reduced by the closure of RAF Nocton Hall Hospital. Much of the land surrounding the villages is owned by Nocton Farms,a large farming concern.The land is generally very flat.
